      23             : 
      24             : // The "main thread" in Gecko will soon be a set of cooperatively scheduled
      25             : // "fibers". Global state in Gecko will be partitioned into a series of "groups"
      26             : // (with roughly one group per tab). Runnables will be annotated with the set of
      27             : // groups that they touch. Two runnables may run concurrently on different
      28             : // fibers as long as they touch different groups.
      29             : //
      30             : // A Dispatcher is an abstract class to represent a "group". Essentially the
      31             : // only functionality offered by a Dispatcher is the ability to dispatch
      32             : // runnables to the group. TabGroup, DocGroup, and SystemGroup are the concrete
      33             : // implementations of Dispatcher.
      34         120 : class SchedulerGroup
      35             : {
      36             : public:
      37             :   SchedulerGroup();
      38             : 
      39             :   NS_INLINE_DECL_PURE_VIRTUAL_REFCOUNTING

      42             :   public:

      44             :     ~AutoProcessEvent();
      45             : 
      46             :   private:

      48             :   };
